what: Using gpt-4o-mini to condense an example report
title: llm4np: language modeling for neuropsychology reports
text: retrieved example PDF neuropsychological (NP) evaluation thepeerconsult.com. parse_nppdf uses pdftools tabulapdf extract text tables reports. paste report text single character vector convenient processing. also view autism ontology based 2015 paper Alexa McCray colleages. Now create agent prompted use ontology summary NP evaluation. now use templated prompt, using report text ontology summary. George Smith, 12-year-old boy, identified highly gifted faces challenges related autism (PTO: Autism Phenotype), ADHD (PTO: Attention Deficit Disorder Hyperactivity), anxiety (PTO: Anxiety). cognitive strengths, particularly problem-solving (PTO: Problem Solving Ability) working memory (PTO: Working Memory), support academic achievements, placing high school graduate level basic skills (PTO: Performance School). Despite remarkable cognitive abilities, George’s fine motor skills (PTO: Fine Motor Skills) processing speed (PTO: Task Performance) notably vulnerable. struggles social perception (PTO: Recognition Social Norms) interpersonal interactions (PTO: Interpersonal Interactions), impacting ability build connections (PTO: Social Competence) engage peers effectively (PTO: Participation Play Activities). George benefits structured learning environments accommodate cognitive needs providing routine (PTO: Adherence Rules Home) emotional support. Continued access therapeutic services (PTO: Comorbidities), including social skills groups (PTO: Social Interest) individualized education (PTO: Diagnosis), aid development social emotional domains. therapy, George encouraged work emotional regulation (PTO: Emotional Regulation Control) coping skills (PTO: Managing Internal Emotions). Support academic tasks, focusing interests (PTO: Intense Interests) providing extra time (PTO: Processing Speed), help nurture exceptional potential navigates social emotional challenges effectively. Ongoing collaboration parents, educators, therapists vital George’s progress (PTO: Medical History). Adaptive strategies within school home settings essential bolster strengths addressing vulnerabilities (PTO: Executive Function), ensuring balanced approach overall development. Strengths: Problem Solving Ability (PTO: Problem Solving Ability), Working Memory (PTO: Working Memory), Intense Interests (PTO: Intense Interests), Performance School (PTO: Performance School), Adherence Rules Home (PTO: Adherence Rules Home). Weaknesses: Autism Phenotype (PTO: Autism Phenotype), Attention Deficit Disorder Hyperactivity (PTO: Attention Deficit Disorder Hyperactivity), Fine Motor Skills (PTO: Fine Motor Skills), Task Performance (PTO: Task Performance), Recognition Social Norms (PTO: Recognition Social Norms), Interpersonal Interactions (PTO: Interpersonal Interactions), Processing Speed (PTO: Processing Speed). Needs: Medical History (PTO: Medical History), Comorbidities (PTO: Comorbidities), Social Interest (PTO: Social Interest), Emotional Regulation Control (PTO: Emotional Regulation Control), Executive Function (PTO: Executive Function).
code: library(wizrd) library(llm4np) pretty_rmd <- function(x) {     x |> strwrap() |> paste(">", text = _, collapse = "\n") |> cat() } nelsonasd = system.file("pdfs", "nelsonAutDeid.pdf", package="llm4np") nels = parse_nppdf(nelsonasd) ## Error : '4.  Educators are also likely to be best able to support George’s emotional, behavioral, and social functioning' does not exist in current working directory ('/Users/vincentcarey/AUTISM/llm4np/vignettes'). ## Error : '    ognitive Skills             ' does not exist in current working directory ('/Users/vincentcarey/AUTISM/llm4np/vignettes'). nels ## Parsed NP pdf with 14 pages and 5 tables. nt = gsub("\\n", " ", paste(nels@text, collapse=" ")) substr(nt, 1, 35) ## [1] "                                   " data(nmdf) head(nmdf) ##         tag                                           val ## 1 Class_634                 Obstetric Delivery Procedures ## 2 Class_385                             Perinatal History ## 3 Class_464 Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity ## 4 Class_455                              Mental Disorders ## 5 Class_689                   Psychiatric Hospitalization ## 6 Class_138                       Psychologic Indications ag = openai_agent("gpt-4o-mini") |>     instruct("You are a helpful assistant with training in neuropsychology.") ag ## <wizrd::Agent> gpt-4o-mini ## @instructions: You are a helpful assistant with training in neuropsychology. ## @io: <wizrd::PlainTextFormat> → ← <wizrd::PlainTextFormat> ## @tools:  ## @params:  ## @backend: <wizrd::OpenAIAPIServer> https://api.openai.com prompted_agent <- ag |> prompt_as("Please summarize the text {txt} in five short paragraphs      of at most 45 words.  Use the      concepts in the 'val' field of {df} as much as possible, choosing the     most specific term that is relevant, and when     you do use these terms, please append the associated value of the 'tag' field     in parentheses, prefixing the tag with 'PTO:'.  After producing the paragraphs,     please produce three lists of tags that were used, corresponding to      'strengths', 'weaknesses' and 'needs'.  Do not use headings with the lists, just provide     the lists as sentences preceded by the category.")  prompted_agent |> predict(list(txt=nt, df=nmdf)) |> pretty_rmd()

what: A second example, no autism diagnosis present
title: llm4np: language modeling for neuropsychology reports
text: Joe, 8-year-old boy history premature birth, Tourette syndrome, ADHD, currently shows challenges attention functioning academic setting. past assessments revealed consistent need support, reflecting vulnerabilities linked neurodevelopmental disorders, particularly managing hyperactivity completing multi-step tasks (PTO: Attention Deficit Disorder Hyperactivity). Observations assessment indicated engaging interpersonal skills cheerful demeanor. However, Joe frequently struggled concentration, often losing track instructions requiring redirection, highlights difficulties executive function processes essential academic success (PTO: Executive Function). findings standardized tests place Joe’s cognitive abilities borderline range, Full Scale IQ 75, suggesting decline previous assessments. Notably, displayed stronger verbal skills compared visual processing capabilities, impacting overall performance adaptability learning environments (PTO: Cognitive Ability). Joe’s language abilities variable, showing challenges receptive expressive capacities, particularly attention demands. displays vocal tics struggles complex tasks requiring integration information across modalities, reflecting need tailored academic support strategies (PTO: Language Ability). Overall, Joe needs structured interventions focusing improving attention strategies, executive function support, personalized educational accommodations foster independence manage neuropsychological challenges effectively school setting (PTO: Performance School). Strengths include: Attention detail (PTO: Planning), Engaging interpersonal skills (PTO: Reciprocity), Cheerful demeanor (PTO: Mood), Strong verbal knowledge base (PTO: Cognitive Ability), Participation sports (PTO: Use Free Time). Weaknesses encompass: Difficulty attention focus (PTO: Attention Focus), Variable language abilities (PTO: Language Ability), Executive function deficits (PTO: Executive Function), Motor control challenges (PTO: Motor Skills), Low processing speed (PTO: Cognitive Ability). Needs: Consistent support executive functions (PTO: Executive Function), Strategies task initiation completion (PTO: Task Completion), Instruction small group settings (PTO: Performance School), Behavioral management tics (PTO: Tics Mannerisms), Tailored academic schedules (PTO: Planning).
code: sqspf = system.file("pdfs", "de-identified+report+1.pdf", package="llm4np") sq = parse_nppdf(sqspf) txt2 = gsub("\\n", " ", paste(sq@text, collapse=" "))  # concatenate text prompted_agent |> predict(list(txt=txt2, df=nmdf)) |> pretty_rmd()
